sentences.en: At the age of five he showed exceptional talent as a musician.
sentences.cn: 他五岁时就表现出非凡的音乐才能。

sentences.en: He established himself as a session musician.
sentences.cn: 他成为了一位伴奏音乐家。

sentences.en: He feels that he was destined to become a musician.
sentences.cn: 他觉得自己注定会成为一名音乐家。

sentences.en: He had been a talented musician in his youth.
sentences.cn: 他年轻时很有音乐天才。

sentences.en: He had long coveted the chance to work with a famous musician.
sentences.cn: 他一直渴望有机会与著名音乐家一起工作。

sentences.en: He has all the makings of a fine musician.
sentences.cn: 他具有优秀音乐家的各种素质.

sentences.en: He is a competent, but not a brilliant musician.
sentences.cn: 作为音乐家,他能胜任, 但缺乏才华.
他是一位才华横溢的音乐家。

sentences.en: He was a very unusual musician inasmuch as he was totally deaf.
sentences.cn: 他是完全失聪的，从这点上来说，他是个很了不起的音乐家。

sentences.en: He was long a famous musician, but he plays no longer.
sentences.cn: 他成为有名的音乐家已很久了, 但他现在不演奏了.
罗日杰斯特文斯基是位出色的音乐家。

sentences.en: She had toured as a backing musician for a rock star.
sentences.cn: 她曾以某摇滚歌星伴奏乐师的身分巡回演出.

sentences.en: That rock musician has a cult following.
sentences.cn: 那个摇滚音乐家拥有大批狂热的崇拜者.

sentences.en: The musician's execution was perfect, but he played without feeling.
sentences.cn: 演奏者的技巧完美, 但他演奏得毫无感情.

sentences.en: The parents are trying to breed their son a musician.
sentences.cn: 这对父母尽力要把儿子培养成为音乐家.

words.tran_cn: 音乐才能；音乐鉴赏力；音乐技巧

trans.tran_en: someone who plays a musical instrument, especially very well or as a job
